greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Every divisor (except 1) contains the digit 5.
link: Amiram Eldar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: 25 has divisors 1, 5 and 25, all of which contain the digit 5.
mathematica: fQ[n_, dgt_] := Union[ MemberQ[#, dgt] & /@ IntegerDigits@ Rest@ Divisors@ n][[1]]; Select[ Range[2, 1500], fQ[#, 5] &] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jun 11 2014 *)
program: (MAGMA) [k:k in [2..1500]| forall{d:d in Set(Divisors(k)) diff {1}| 5 in Intseq(d)}]; // _Marius A. Burtea_, Nov 07 2019
results.author: _Erich Friedman_, Jul 04 2001
